meanings.definition: To go out or depart from a place.
meanings.sent1: I need to outgo from the party early.
meanings.sent2: The students outgo from the classroom at the bell.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to outgo through the open window.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts outgo to the peaceful countryside.
meanings.sent5: The birds outgo from their nests at dawn.

meanings.definition: The act of going out or departing.
meanings.sent1: The outgo of the train was delayed due to a signal issue.
meanings.sent2: We watched the outgo of the ships from the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The outgo of the squirrel from the tree was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The outgo of the river into the sea was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The outgo of the hikers into the forest was filled with excitement.

meanings.definition: The amount of money spent or paid out.
meanings.sent1: She carefully tracked every outgo in her budget.
meanings.sent2: The company's outgo on advertising was significant.
meanings.sent3: The outgo on snacks for the party was higher than expected.
meanings.sent4: His outgo on gifts for his family was generous.
meanings.sent5: The outgo on repairs for the car was unavoidable.
